text: Leptochilus cantoniensis is a species of fern in the family Polypodiaceae. It is endemic to China. Its natural habitats are subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests and subtropical or tropical moist montane forests. It is threatened by habitat loss. ==References== Category:Polypodiaceae Category:Flora of China Category:Vulnerable plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot Category:Taxa named by John Gilbert Baker Category:Taxa named by Ren-Chang Ching
title: Leptochilus cantoniensis
